alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 12:26AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Natrona County, including Casper and Mills. * WHEN...Until 145 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1225 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in Casper and Mills. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Casper, Mills, Paradise Valley, Fort Caspar Campground, Central Wyoming Fairgrounds and Casper Events Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
